CONJUGATES: X-rays (n, pl) | X-rays (v, 3rd sing) | X-rayed (v, past) | X-raying (v, present part)
ETYMOLOGY: Coined in 1895 by German physicist Wilhelm Conrad Röntgen, who used 'X' to denote an unknown type of radiation (X-Strahlung) because its nature was not yet understood.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A form of electromagnetic radiation, high in energy and short in wavelength, capable of passing through many materials opaque to light.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种高能、短波长的电磁辐射，能够穿透许多对可见光不透明的物质。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The invention of the X-ray revolutionized medical diagnostics.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: X射线的发明彻底改变了医学诊断。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A photographic image produced by using X-rays, typically used to view the internal structure of a body or object.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 使用X射线拍摄的照片或图像，通常用于查看身体或物体的内部结构。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The doctor took an X-ray of my ankle to confirm the fracture.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 医生给我脚踝拍了X光片以确认骨折。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To examine, photograph, or treat someone or something using X-rays.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 使用X射线检查、拍摄或处理某人或某物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Security staff X-ray every piece of luggage before boarding.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 安检人员在登机前会对每一件行李进行X光检查。
